intro: Delissea scabra var. variabilis, commonly known as the rough delissea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and spikes of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its unique morphology and ornamental value make it a sought-after species in horticulture.
